Name: Tweak
Description: Adjust hue, saturation, brightness, and contrast.

UI.Description: Adjust the color hue of the image.
Adjust the color saturation of the image by controlling gain of the color channels.
Change the brightness of the image by applying a constant bias to the luma channel.
Change the contrast of the image by multiplying the luma values by a constant.

When set to true (the default), the luma (Y) and chroma are clipped to TV-range; 
When set to false, the luma and chroma are unconstrained.

The hue and saturation will be adjusted for image values in the range [startHue, endHue]
when startHue<endHue. Note that the hue is periodic, thus a hue of 360 degrees corresponds with a hue of zero degrees.

The hue and saturation will be adjusted for image values in the range [startHue, endHue]
when startHue<endHue. Note that the hue is periodic, thus a hue of 360 degrees corresponds with a hue of zero degrees.

The hue and saturation will be adjusted for image values in the range [minSat, maxSat]. 
Practically speaking, the percentage saturation of a pixel will be in the range [0, 100]
since these correspond to valid RGB pixels (100% corresponds to R=255d, G=B=0d, which has a saturation of 119 in units of chroma).
An overshoot (up to 150%) is allowed for non-valid RGB pixels (150% corresponds to U=V=255d, which has a saturation of √(1272+1272) = 180).
Thus when using the default values all pixels will be processed. 
Range 0 to 150; default 150, 0; minSat must be less than maxSat

The hue and saturation will be adjusted for image values in the range [minSat, maxSat]. 
Practically speaking, the percentage saturation of a pixel will be in the range [0, 100]
since these correspond to valid RGB pixels (100% corresponds to R=255d, G=B=0d, which has a saturation of 119 in units of chroma).
An overshoot (up to 150%) is allowed for non-valid RGB pixels (150% corresponds to U=V=255d, which has a saturation of √(1272+1272) = 180).
Thus when using the default values all pixels will be processed. 
Range 0 to 150; default 150, 0; minSat must be less than maxSat
Interpolate the saturation adjustment at the edges of the chosen range to prevent banding.
When true, ordered dithering is applied when doing the adjustment. (default false)
When true, force 'no-lookup': pure float calculation of new pixel values (always true for certain Deep Color formats)

Control dithering amount.
For example, dither_strength=1.0 adds ±0.5 amplitude dither on the 0..255 range, and scaled in proportion for other ranges.
